Reviews.Content: Ok, I guess.. I booked my room prior to seeing all the bad reviews on this site. I must admit, I went there expecting the worst. The lobby was clean and the staff were very nice to me upon my arrival so I started to feel a little better. I was given a room on the sixth floor in the main building, not the tower, so that was also a plus. When I stepped off the elevator on the sixth floor, I was greeted by the strong smell of stale cigarette smoke. It was sickening, as I hate cigarette smoke to begin with. I quickly made my way to my room, again, expecting the worst. I was pleasantly surprised though when I opened my room door. The room was clean and there were no bad smells as I expected. Everything worked and the internet connection was nice and fast so I was feeling better about my decision. A couple things did bother me though. The water pressure in the shower was terrible. You also had to let the hot water run a very, very long time before it got hot. The mattress had some sort of industrial strength plastic protective covering under sheets which made it very hard to get comfortable in the bed. The safety latch on the door was broken off and never replaced which made me a little uncomfortable. On the bright side, the little cafe in the lobby had some fantastic food on the buffet!! The cafe staff was very cheerful and gracious towards me as well. All in all it wasn't that bad of a stay. I just can't shake the feeling that I just got lucky this time.
Reviews.Author: ghost446

Reviews.Content: Loud night in New Orleans! The Best Western Landmark was very nice. Our room was clean and properly maintained. The bed was very comfortable and the first night was quiet. The second night was awful. There was a reception in the party room. The music was so loud we could hear it in our room. We will NOT be returning to this hotel. We are frequent visitors to New Orleans and we will be finding another place to stay!
Reviews.Author: alw24

Reviews.Content: Its a dump Smelly, unclean and worn. Not worth the money. Breakfast costs $8 and is worse than what you get for free at some other places. I wont go back and will try to avoid anything associated with Best Western. It does not stand for quality.
Reviews.Author: GKissle

Reviews.Content: Hotel room was nice, lobby area could use work I stayed at this hotel for just 1 night due to flying out of the New Orleans airport the next morning. Everything about the room was just fine, my only problem was the front desk area needs a little work, and there was not really a good spot for my car during check-in. I would stay at this hotel again, staff was very nice.
Reviews.Author: dpminc

Reviews.Content: What's that smell? Let me first start off by saying that the reviews that I read on this site were accurate in it's description of this hotel. I wished that I had listened rather than ignore them. My family and I stayed at this hotel from July 15th - July 19th. When we checked in we were intially assigned to room 914. As soon as we opened the door we were greeted with a terrible odor that wreaked throughout the halls and only worsened as we had entered the room. In an attempt to find the source of this odor I tried to turn on the lights throughout the room only to find out that the light in the bathroom was out. Next, in an attempt to find fresh air, I tried to open the balcony door only to find that in had been sealed shut. I then contacted the front desk, who I must add were polite and courteous, and asked to be moved to another room. I was then moved to room 1004, which was just a small improvement from room 914 (bathroom light was not out). At that point my family and I had decided to try to make the best of our sitiation, after calling around to different hotels and finding out that they were booked of course. In ordor to improve the mildew smell that wreaked throughout the room (and halls for that matter) we made a stop at Target and picked up a large bottle of Febreeze in our attempt to combat the foul odor. Let's just say, it did not help much. So in closing I will advise you NOT to stay at this hotel. Apart from the friendly and courteous staff, this hotel is a wash....
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a Serious renovation! We stayed at this hotel July 1 - 5 during the Essence Music Festival. Unfortunately, the only positive note of our stay at this hotel was that we were allowed to check in early! The hotel definitely shows its age and wear. The ceiling tiles are dingy and the tile and carpet in the lobby and common areas are worn and faded. The walls and doors of the room were thin and we frequently were awakened at night by the TV's and voices of other guests and staff. The old HVAC unit in our room worked; however, it was covered with dust and dirt to the point that we didn't even want to touch the switch to turn it on and off. There were splotches of paint on the walls in different areas - obviously repairs had been made at some point or another, but the fix up was not done carefully. We didn't have much interaction with the staff and except for one occasion, our room had been made up upon our return each evening. I definitely would not stay at the Best Western Landmark again and would not recommend it to anyone else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely inexpensive hotel I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The rooms were quiet, clean, inexpensive and everything functioned just fine. The staff bent over backwards to be helpful and courteous. It is rather far out so would not be my choice for an extended visit to New Orleans, but for short stays and coming and going from Louis B Armstrong International Airport, it is my hotel of choice.
Reviews.Author: Douglas Reid

Reviews.Content: The worst Best Western We queued to check-in not because the staff were particularly busy but they were having a wonderful time joking with each other and totally ignoring the guests waiting to be checked in. Eventually we were given our key and went to our room where I unfortunately took my shoes off, the water came oozing up between my toes, the entire carpet was saturated. I complained to the front desk and they said it was probably the airconditioning unit which they would fix but they said we would have to have the room because it was the last one. In short I complained so loudly that they found us a new room which had stained carpet, torn blankets and smelled badly.We were awakened all night with slamming doors.The shuttle buses were few and far between and often overbooked so in our case my husband with an old gentleman were just put in the luggage compartment at the rear of the van without a seat. Your only other option to get to the Latin Quarter was a long walk then bus then tram or taxi.Whenever we approached the front desk for information we were fobbed off rudely and quite often given the wrong information.
Reviews.Author: corky2112

Reviews.Content: worst hotel I have ever stayed at We had nothing but problems with this place, no hot water, smelled funny, unreliable shuttles, rude staff, and an enormous blood stain on my bed (or at least that is what it looked like), no fitted sheets, etc etc. I would rather stay in a tent
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Greatly Disappointed Stayed there twice - first stay was in the newer rectangular section and was fine. LAST stay was in the older round tower section. The carpets were old and dirty. The bedspreads were also old and dirty. The sheets were worn. Worst of all, the sliding glass door to the balcony could not be closed and left a 1 gap open to the noise, wind and cold from outside. Very, very noisy all night long with younger people coming and going well past 3:00 a.m. I would not stay here again nor could I recommend staying here unless there were no other rooms available and spending the night was a necessity.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Ugly Green Tower After driving for 2 days, I was disappointed to see the hotel as it was but then again it is just a hotel not home. My husband and I attended an AOL bash and had a wonderful time with the people but the hotel had little entertainment. The club had decent live music but there is no other entertainment in the local vicinity other than a bar around the corner. The restaurant was understaffed and the food was rather cheap in quantity. The service for the rooms was ok although it smelled like a cigarette factory on most of the floors. The staff at the front desk could have been more accomodating and their attitudes towards out of towners was poor. The rooms need an uplift in decor and cleanliness is not a forte as we saw the thickness of dust/dirt on the rugs and around the bed. Breakfast should be called a snack, as the food was cold and not much to talk about for what they charged. Although we will definitely make a trip to New Orleans again, as the city is wonderful..we will never stay at the Landmark due to its poor location to the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: If you like to party this is the place to go. I went there last year around prom time. The place was a party house full of young drunks that were attending a party at the top of the tower. The first room we got was in the tower and it was terrible. It smelled like stale beer and there were leftover items from the previous guests. The second room we got was the same deal. I became upset and the fron desk gave me a room that was on the new side of the hotel. It was acceptable but I doubt that I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
